channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The global players in Syria before and after Assad
item.description: Global powers who have been involved in the 13-year civil war have a vested interest after Assad's fall.

item.title: Israel confirms attack on Syrian naval fleet
item.description: The BBC has verified videos showing blasts in the Syrian port of Latakia, as Israel conducts strikes across Syria.

item.title: Dec 10: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: Police charge 26-year-old Luigi Mangione with murder after UnitedHealthcare CEO's killing; Open AI launches text-to-video AI model.

item.title: Poet and activist Nikki Giovanni dies at age 81
item.description: Nikki Giovanni, who gained fame over her long career as a poet, author and public speaker, has died at the age of 81. She was the subject of the recen...

item.title: Will HELOC interest rates continue dropping this December?
item.description: HELOC interest rates have been on a decline for much of 2024 but will they continue to drop this month?

item.title: Suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO struggles, shouts while entering courthouse
item.description: The suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare’s CEO struggled with deputies and shouted while arriving for a court appearance in Pennsylvania a day a...

item.title: Police say UnitedHealthcare's CEO was likely killed with a ghost gun. What are they?
item.description: Police say the suspect had a ghost gun, possibly made with a 3D printer, when he was arrested on Monday. Here's what to know about the increasingly wi...

item.title: Kroger and Albertsons grocery megamerger halted by federal court
item.description: The ruling makes it increasingly likely that Kroger might abandon its $24.6 billion plan to buy Albertsons. The merger would have combined two of Amer...

item.title: Kroger's $24.6 billion purchase of Albertsons halted by federal judge
item.description: Merger would curtail competition for grocery shoppers, Oregon court finds in a decision that likely derails the deal.

item.title: Jamie Foxx reveals he had a stroke in 2023
item.description: The Hollywood star said he cannot remember the first 20 days following the stroke in April last year.

item.title: 5 things to watch as Syria confronts a new future
item.description: The sudden collapse of President Bashar al-Assad has come as welcome news to many, but there are jitters both inside and outside the country about wha...

item.title: Trump-era Justice Department subpoenaed congressional staffers, watchdog finds
item.description: But the department's internal watchdog found no evidence of political motivation by federal prosecutors.

item.title: An Afghan museum, that buried its artifacts after Taliban takeover, is reborn online
item.description: The Afghanistan Memory Home Museum shares details and belongings from those who've died in conflict. It shut its doors when the Taliban took power, bu...

item.title: I hope Assad pays the price, says mother whose son's death inflamed 2011 Syrian revolution
item.description: Hamza al-Khatib, 13, was arrested at a 2011 anti-government rally and tortured - but Assad's downfall has not brought his family justice.

item.title: From wealth and success to murder suspect, the life of Luigi Mangione took a hard turn
UnitedHealthcare CEO was likely killed with a ghost gun that can be made at home
US gives $20bn to Ukraine funded by seized Russian assets
item.description: The move means Russia is being forced to "bear the costs of its illegal war", the US Treasury said.

item.title: Syrians await Turkey border entry after fall of Assad's regime
item.description: Syrian refugees who fled to Turkey during President Bashar al-Assad's regime are awaiting entry back into their country after the militant group Hayat...
